heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 08 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.6°C), outside temperature (down 9.2°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 7475 lux) and cloud levels (up 476 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7920 lux), dew point temperature (up 9.3°C), outside temperature (up 10.4°C), and cloud levels (up 454 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 475.8m lower than yesterday, 334.2m lower than the past week, 454.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 993m to 2630m and averaged 1146.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; extremely cold temperatures will prevail. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dark. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (3.1°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
